text:
Comments FERNANDO LLORENTE has revealed Swansea’s relegation battle cost him a move to Chelsea. 
The Spaniard was lined up by Antonio Conte as back-up to Diego Costa in case injury struck during Blues ‘ title run-in. Reuters Llorente (right) netted a vital double to secure a win at Liverpool 
But a move fell through as Swans boss Paul Clement would not part with the eight-goal striker. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Chelsea news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Llorente , 31, said: “I already know Conte from Juventus . 
“But it’s difficult in the winter when there’s a way out from a side you’re playing for and it’s normal that they didn’t go ahead with the deal. 
“I’m very focused on the team and am looking forward to helping save us from relegation. Liverpool 2-3 Swansea : Llorente brace leaves Klopp’s title dream in tatters EPA Llorente in action during Swansea's 2-1 defeat to Man City Reuters Llorente got a hug from City boss Pep Guardiola at full-time PA:Press Association But it was Chelsea chief Antonio Conte who wanted Llorente in January 
"The last few games I've been happy with as we've gotten away from the bottom. 
"It will be a very tough fight, though, and we hope to get further ahead when we face Leicester in a final next Sunday." The former Sevilla, Juve and Bilbao ace netted a crucial double to help the Swans to a vital win over Liverpool at Anfield. 
And Clement has admitted he was not always sure that Llorente would stay until after that game. Getty Images Swansea boss Paul Clement reveals he had talks with Llorente Swansea 3-0 Sunderland : Fernando Llorente double for the Swans 
He said: "After that game he had at Liverpool, he felt good. "We're happy with him so when both parties are happy, there's no need to move. 
"Of course, it can put questions in a player's mind, but in my conversations with him he has been happy here." Fernando Llorente bags incredible brace for Swansea to see off Crystal Palace
